A semi-monthly paying structure occurs when employees receive paychecks twice each month, often on the 15th and 30th days of each month. Calculate hourly wages from a semi-monthly pay period to break down earnings for your employees. Step 1. Multiply an employee's semi-monthly salary by two to find the employee's monthly salary. Then multiply the employee's monthly salary by 12 to find the annual salary. 1 Calculate overtime earnings, if applicable. 2  Multiply the employee's hourly wage by the overtime pay rate by the overtime hours worked. 3  For example, if the employee earning $23.07 per hour worked eight hours of overtime at time-and-a-half, multiply $23.07 x 1.5 = $34.61 x 8 = $276.84.

Question. I am being changed from salary exempt to hourly. The way they are breaking it down is: total salary, by 52 weeks, by a 50 hour per week. This decreases my current hourly rate based on 40 hours. However they are only allowing as to work 40 hours and not authorizing the additional 10 per week. This is not correct. It should be broken down by annual salary divided by 2080. If you are working 40 hours x 52 weeks it is 2080 hours per year. Hourly employees are calculated on 40 hour weeks and anything over 40 is overtime.

Divide biweekly gross by the number of days in the pay period to arrive at daily rate. For example, the biweekly gross is $2,000 and you work a standard 40-hour week; the daily rate is $200, the equivalent of $2,000/10 days. Related Reading: How to Calculate Hourly Rates for Bonuses.

This salary was calculated using the average salary for all jobs with the term breakdown anywhere in the job listing.

A job with one week of unpaid leave, for example, will yield the equivalent of 2,040 hours a year while one with two weeks of unpaid leave will yield 2,000 paid hours. If you want to break an annual salary down to an hourly rate, reverse the process. For an hourly position with paid time off, divide the annual salary by 2,080 to get the gross hourly wage. Why 2,080? Most hourly jobs pay you for 2,080 hours of work a year, including paid vacation weeks. That is 52 weeks at 40 hours a week. So $10 an hour will translate into 10 x 2080 = $20,800 a year and $15 an hour will translate into $31,200 a year.
